channel.title: Compiler messed up
channel.description:
ok i have no idea what is rong with my compiler and none of my friends know how to if any1 does plz tell me
it says exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/sun/tools/javac/main Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.sun.tools.java.Main at java.net. URLClassLoader$1.run<URLClassLoader.java:200> at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged<Native Method> at java.net.URLCassLoader.findClass<URLClassLoader.java:188> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass<ClassLoader.java:306> at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass<Launcher.java:276> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass<ClassLoader.java:251> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal<ClassLoader.java:319> Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .
What do i do to fix this???/ if any1 knows plz tell me

item.title: Compiler messed up
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“Fliposheaota, post:3, topic:239030”]I can Fix one of the questions you asked me
Anti Syi’er (The way i do it it only allows 1 ip per person)
Purpose: Stops multi login. This might stop SYI

Difficulty: 0/10

Assumed Knowledge: Copy And Paste

Classes Modified: Client

Declare this

 public boolean isIpOn(String ip) {
  for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
   if(p != null) {
    client person = (client)p;
   if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")) {
   if(person.connectedFrom.equalsIgnoreCase(ip) && !person.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerName)) {
    return true;
   }
  }
  }
 }
 return false;
 }That method will check to see if there 2 players with the same ip address on at ther same time.

In the Run() method add this

if(isIpOn(connectedFrom)) {
    System.out.println(playerName+" Has been stoped from logging in because there are to many connections from his/her IP");
    outStream.createFrame(109);
    returnCode = 9;
    disconnected = true;
    destruct();
 }See the System.out.printIn(""); that method will print whatever is in the "" in the server console
The returnCode = 9; will make the client say "There are to many loggins from your ip address
disconnected = true; will kick the person
destruct(); will make sure the person is kicked

Now Make sure that you get the proper anti nuller so here you are:

import java.net.*;declare this socket in there 2:

[CODE]public Socket acceptSocketSafe(ServerSocket x) {
boolean socketFound = false;
Socket s = null;
do {
try {
s = x.accept();
int i = s.getInputStream().read();
if ((i & 0xFF) == 14) {
socketFound = true;
}
} catch (Exception e) {
}
} while (!socketFound);

return s;
}

[/CODE]

last step

go to

public void run and replace it with this:

public void run() {
try {
shutdownClientHandler = false;
clientListener = new java.net.ServerSocket(serverlistenerPort, 1, null);
misc.println("- Ploxagescape Online -");
while(true) {
java.net.Socket s = acceptSocketSafe(clientListener);
s.setTcpNoDelay(true);
String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();
boolean checkPloxageBanned = false;
try {
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./data/bannedips.txt"));
String data = null;
while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) {
if (connectingHost.startsWith(data))
checkPloxageBanned = true;
  }
}
} catch (IOException e) {
checkPloxageBanned = false;
}
if(clientListener != null && checkPloxageBanned == false) {
int Found = -1;
for (int i = 0; i < MaxConnections; i++) {
if (Connections[i] == connectingHost) {
Found = ConnectionCount[i];
break;
}
}
if (Found < 3) {
misc.println("Connection accepted from "+connectingHost+": "+s.getPort()+".");
playerHandler.newPlayerClient(s, connectingHost);
} else {
s.close();
}
} else {
misc.println(" "+connectingHost+" is IP-Banned Ploxagescape style and cannot log in gf? .");
s.close();
}
}
} catch(java.io.IOException ioe) {
if(!shutdownClientHandler) {
misc.println("Cant start your port on "+serverlistenerPort+", could be on already =P ");
} else {
misc.println("ClientHandler = ShutDown.");
}
}
}

And for the Compiler
And Pimped fucking is a nerd who just said something that i needed to say
so i cant say now
Sorry :l[/quote]

Yea why don’t you fucking post a leeched tutorial…save it for tutorial section dumbass.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler messed up
item.dc:creator: @Fliposheaota Fliposheaota
item.description:
@Fliposheaota wrote:

I can Fix one of the questions you asked me
Anti Syi’er (The way i do it it only allows 1 ip per person)
Purpose: Stops multi login. This might stop SYI

Difficulty: 0/10

Assumed Knowledge: Copy And Paste

Classes Modified: Client

Declare this

 public boolean isIpOn(String ip) {
  for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
   if(p != null) {
    client person = (client)p;
   if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")) {
   if(person.connectedFrom.equalsIgnoreCase(ip) && !person.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerName)) {
    return true;
   }
  }
  }
 }
 return false;
 }That method will check to see if there 2 players with the same ip address on at ther same time.

In the Run() method add this

if(isIpOn(connectedFrom)) {
    System.out.println(playerName+" Has been stoped from logging in because there are to many connections from his/her IP");
    outStream.createFrame(109);
    returnCode = 9;
    disconnected = true;
    destruct();
 }See the System.out.printIn(""); that method will print whatever is in the "" in the server console
The returnCode = 9; will make the client say "There are to many loggins from your ip address
disconnected = true; will kick the person
destruct(); will make sure the person is kicked

Now Make sure that you get the proper anti nuller so here you are:

import java.net.*;declare this socket in there 2:

[CODE]public Socket acceptSocketSafe(ServerSocket x) {
boolean socketFound = false;
Socket s = null;
do {
try {
s = x.accept();
int i = s.getInputStream().read();
if ((i & 0xFF) == 14) {
socketFound = true;
}
} catch (Exception e) {
}
} while (!socketFound);

return s;
}

[/CODE]

last step

go to

public void run and replace it with this:

public void run() {
try {
shutdownClientHandler = false;
clientListener = new java.net.ServerSocket(serverlistenerPort, 1, null);
misc.println("- Ploxagescape Online -");
while(true) {
java.net.Socket s = acceptSocketSafe(clientListener);
s.setTcpNoDelay(true);
String connectingHost = s.getInetAddress().getHostName();
boolean checkPloxageBanned = false;
try {
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./data/bannedips.txt"));
String data = null;
while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) {
if (connectingHost.startsWith(data))
checkPloxageBanned = true;
  }
}
} catch (IOException e) {
checkPloxageBanned = false;
}
if(clientListener != null && checkPloxageBanned == false) {
int Found = -1;
for (int i = 0; i < MaxConnections; i++) {
if (Connections[i] == connectingHost) {
Found = ConnectionCount[i];
break;
}
}
if (Found < 3) {
misc.println("Connection accepted from "+connectingHost+": "+s.getPort()+".");
playerHandler.newPlayerClient(s, connectingHost);
} else {
s.close();
}
} else {
misc.println(" "+connectingHost+" is IP-Banned Ploxagescape style and cannot log in gf? .");
s.close();
}
}
} catch(java.io.IOException ioe) {
if(!shutdownClientHandler) {
misc.println("Cant start your port on "+serverlistenerPort+", could be on already =P ");
} else {
misc.println("ClientHandler = ShutDown.");
}
}
}

And for the Compiler
And Pimped fucking is a nerd who just said something that i needed to say
so i cant say now
Sorry :l
